title: weird "private trait" errors around ptr::metadata for public struct wrapping private trait object
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=bf288d74a24e2a8d9f6c22d96d7e2f39

```rust
#![feature(ptr_metadata)]

mod foo {
    trait P<'a> {}
    pub struct S<'a>(dyn P<'a>);
}

fn f<'a>(a: &mut foo::S<'a>) {
    let mut b = None;
    b = Some(std::ptr::metadata(a));
}
```

I expected to see this happen: it'd just compile

Instead, this happened: 

```
error: trait `P` is private
 --> src/lib.rs:9:17
  |
9 |     let mut b = None;
  |                 ^^^^ private trait

error: trait `P` is private
  --> src/lib.rs:10:9
   |
10 |     b = Some(std::ptr::metadata(a));
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ private trait
```

I guess it doesn't like inferring `DynMetadata<dyn P<'a>>` since `P` is private, but I don't understand why that happens since I'm not naming `P` there, and even if I was, the error highlighting `None` is super confusing.

Not sure how to reduce it to not touch `ptr::metadata` since I'm not sure I understand how the metadata types work.
